items.title: Google starts rolling out Gemini for Home to early access users
items.summary: Gemini is now arriving on your Google Home app, bringing key new capabilities like "Ask Home."
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Google has started rolling out Gemini for Home to Google Home users. To try Geminiâ€™s Home features, such as Ask Home, you need to sign up for the early access program. Later this month, Google will start rolling out Gemini for Home more broadly to early access users in the US. Google has started rolling out Gemini for Home to Google Home users who signed up for the early access program. The company announced Gemini for Home just last week, with headline features like Ask Home, which lets you search your devices, video history, and more by asking questions in natural language. Gemini will also enable AI-generated descriptions and context for notifications, summarize moments with the new Home Brief , and more.

items.title: Pixel 10 is going viral for struggling with a major Android game (Updated: Google statement)
items.summary: The game technically doesn't support the Pixel 10's GPU, but is it really that bad?
items.body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority TL;DR Viral videos show the Pixel 10 Pro XL completely glitching out while running the latest version of Genshin Impact. The problems could be related to the Pixel 10 shipping with a PowerVR GPU, for which the gameâ€™s makers dropped support earlier this year. A future driver update might fix performance issues, but if game developers keep dropping support for PowerVR GPUs, Google may need to rethink its strategy. Google says they have worked with miHoYo over the past year to ensure the game runs smoothly on the Pixel 10 series. Updated: October 7, 2025 (12 AM ET): A Google spokesperson provided the following statement to Android Authority, clarifying that Genshin Impact will continue running on the Pixel 10 series.

items.title: First they took our chargers, now our cables are next: Are phone makers going too far?
items.summary: Smartphone brands think you'll be fine without bundled cables, but will you?
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority Weâ€™ve watched smartphone boxes get lighter and barer over the past few years as manufacturers opt for minimalistic packaging. It started with the removal of charging bricks, a move that many users still havenâ€™t fully accepted. And now, it looks like USB cables might be next on the chopping block.

items.title: Jennifer Lopez Was â€˜Born to Playâ€™ â€˜Kiss of the Spider Womanâ€™ Role, Ben Affleck Says as Exes Reunite on RedÂ Carpet
items.summary: J.Lo stars in the movie musical, for which Affleck served as a producer through his & Matt Damon's Artists Equity production company.
items.body: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck both played a part in the making of the movie musical Kiss of the Spider Woman , and the exes were both on hand Monday night (Oct. 6) for the film’s New York red-carpet screening, reuniting publicly for the first time since their divorce was final in January. Lopez stars as Ingrid Luna/Aurora/The Spider Woman, while Affleck and Matt Damon’s Artists Equity production company is one of the producers behind the film, which is an adaptation of the 1976 novel of the same name by Argentine author Manuel Puig that also inspired a 1985 movie and a 1993 Broadway musical. items.title: Rise Festival 2025 Rises Above Night 1 Weather Issues for an Elevated Desert Weekend With RÃ¼fÃ¼s du Sol, Calvin Harris & JohnÂ Mayer
items.summary: Happening on a dry lakebed outside Las Vegas from Oct. 3-5, the festival overcame early challenges to host a lineup of stars and a genuinely special lantern release.
items.body: As Stone Temple Pilots once said, so much depends on the weather. On Friday in the Mojave Desert, roughly 30 miles southwest of Las Vegas, Rise festival learned this the hard way, which is to say the weather did not cooperate. High winds and attendant dust forced Rise organizers to open the gates almost three hours late, with the night’s set times subsequently shuffled and the eveningâ€™s centerpiece event â€” the release of thousands of paper lanterns into the sky â€” canceled entirely. Meanwhile, reports of hourslong wait times for attendees arriving from the Vegas Strip by shuttle, plus sparse food options, were posted on social media by many incensed pass holders in the time during and after night 1. The internet pile-on was swift and harsh, and the vibe on the grounds Friday night was, in many moments, challenging. The wind and dust got in eyes and nostrils, for many necessitating face masks, with chilly winds adding a bite to the air. Some waited in long lines for drinks and food while others (like us) sailed right up with no problem. As many in the crowd stood protecting their eyes while standing amid hundreds of unlit torches, reminding us that the night’s core activâ€¦

items.title: BLACKPINKâ€™s JISOO Teases Surprise Duet With Zayn Malik: â€˜Two Voices, OneÂ Orbitâ€™
items.summary: Zayn was previously seen attending BLACKPINKâ€™s New York concert on July 27, accompanied by his daughter, Khai.
items.body: BLACKPINK â€™s JISOO has hinted at the release of a surprise duet this month. On Monday (Oct. 6), she unveiled a mysterious teaser image on social media, featuring a shadowed male silhouette standing behind her, with the word â€œEYESCLOSEDâ€ written across the frame â€” suggesting an upcoming collaboration. “A duet is near,” the caption reads. A second post brought the shadowed male closer to the forefront, with the caption: “two voices, one orbit. coming soon.” The mysterious collaborator has been revealed to be Zayn Malik , a former member of One Direction. In the teaser, JISOO stands in the foreground while the male figure looms behind her â€” his back turned, adding intrigue to the release. Zayn was previously seen attending BLACKPINKâ€™s New York concert on July 27, accompanied by his daughter, Khai. After the show, he shared a photo from the audience with the caption: â€œ@BLACKPINKOFFICIAL THANK YOU ğŸ™‚ ME & KHAI LOVED IT,â€ sparking curiosity about the connection between the two artists. The upcoming duet will mark JISOOâ€™s first new music release since her solo EP Amortage  in February, which featured tracks like â€œEarthquake,â€ â€œYour Loveâ€ and â€œHugs & Kâ€¦

items.title: AEG Signs Landmark Deal to Run U.K. Venues on â€˜Deep GreenÂ Energyâ€™
items.summary: The O2 in London and other venues are included in the initiative.
items.body: AEG Europe announced a landmark agreement on Tuesday (Oct. 7) that will make its U.K. venues the first to run on the countryâ€™s greenest energy. The European subsidiary of the global live entertainment promoter AEG has collaborated with green energy company Ecotricity on the agreement, which includes the introduction of PPAs (Power Purchase Agreements) with a 100% renewable energy supply, and is backed by hourly-matched REGOs (Renewable Energy Guarantees of Origin). Related The O2’s Steve Sayer on Running a Global-Leading Venue, Setting Green Standards and The BRITs Moving to Manchester Sylvan Esso Is Pulling Its Catalog From Spotify How Blond:ish Plans to Eliminate 42 Tons of Waste From NYC Nightlife Every Year: 'This Is My Passion' The PPAs will allocate specific renewable energy assets to a number of AEGâ€™s venue portfolio in the U.K. including The O2 in London, indigo at The O2, Eventim Apollo, Watford Colosseum and University of Wolverhampton at The Halls. As a result, these venues will operate predominantly on the deepest green energy generated by solar and hydro assets and meet audit-level scrutiny and transparency standards. â€œPPAs are widely recognised aâ€¦

items.title: GLAAD eBay Auction Includes Swag Signed by Adam Lambert, Sam Smith, Barbra Streisand &Â More
items.summary: And it's all for a good cause.
items.body: Want some Barbra Streisand vinyl, signed by the legendary diva herself? Or an autographed NASA jacket from the Queen + Adam Lambert tour, signed by the onetime American Idol contestant? How about signed swag and a meet & greet with KATSEYE , Sam Smith , Brandy & Monica , Chelsea Handler or Atsuko Okatsuka? Hereâ€™s your chance. GLAAD â€“ the world’s largest LGBTQ media advocacy organization â€“ has announced an eBay auction of celebrity swag in honor of #SpiritDay. 100% of the proceeds will benefit GLAAD in support of their mission to accelerate acceptance for the LGBTQ community. Launching globally Monday (Oct. 6) and running through Oct. 16 at eBay.com/glaad , the auction will give fans the opportunity to bid on one-of-a-kind items and experiences from celebrity GLAAD supporters. Auction items include: Adam Lambert: Autographed NASA Jacket from the 2019 Queen + Adam Lambert Rhapsody Tour in Houston. Atsuko Okatsuka: Two tickets + meet & greet to see Atsuko Okatsuka on The Big Bowl Tour. Barbra Streisand: Signed vinyl of The Secret of Life: Partners, Volume Two . Brandy & Monica: Two tickets + meet & greet to see the R&B stars on The Boy Is Mine Tour. Chelâ€¦

items.title: Chandler Moore & Naomi Raine Announce Exit From Maverick City Music: â€˜Godâ€™s Not DoneÂ Yetâ€™
items.summary: The worship music collective Maverick City Music is known for songs including "Jireh."
items.body: Two of Grammy-winning worship collective Maverick City Music ‘s members, Chandler Moore and Naomi Raine, have announced their departures from the group. On Monday (Oct. 6), both artists released statements on social media, revealing their decisions to exit the group. Each artist also emphasized that they will continue to make music outside of Maverick City Music. Related Maverick City Musicâ€™s Chandler Moore Scores First Gospel Airplay No. 1 on His Own With â€˜Lead Me Onâ€™ Rise Festival 2025 Rises Above Night 1 Weather Issues for an Elevated Desert Weekend With RÃ¼fÃ¼s du Sol, Calvin Harris & John Mayer BLACKPINK's JISOO Teases Surprise Duet With Zayn Malik: 'Two Voices, One Orbit' “These last two years I’ve been locked in on what really matters…in my life and my career,” Moore wrote on social media. “It’s been scary at times, but it’s also been full of fresh vision and real excitement about the future. With that, I’ve made the bittersweet decision to end my relationship with Maverick City Music. When we started Mav, I was grateful to have community and belonging while fulfilling my dream of making music that â€¦

items.title: Central Cee Scores His First No. 1 on Rap & Rhythmic Airplay Charts With â€˜Which Oneâ€™ â€” As Drake Extends Records for Most of AllÂ Time
items.summary: Drake strings together his fourth No. 1 in a row on Rhythmic Airplay, all coming in 2025.
items.body: Drake â€™s 43rd No. 1 on Billboard â€™s Rhythmic Airplay chart is courtesy of his Central Cee collaboration â€œWhich One,â€ which lifts 2-1 on the tally dated Oct. 11. With â€œWhich One,â€ Drake strings together his fourth No. 1 in a row on the list — all coming in 2025. â€œNokiaâ€ reigned for two weeks in May, followed by the PARTYNEXTDOOR and Cash Cobain collaboration â€œSomebody Loves Meâ€ in July for a week and the three-week rule of â€œWhat Did I Miss?â€ beginning in August. That run equals Drakeâ€™s longest streak of rulers on Rhythmic Airplay. He previously went four in a row between 2018 and 2019, albeit largely as a featured act on Bad Bunny â€™s â€œMIAâ€ and Meek Mill â€™s â€œGoing Badâ€ and Chris Brown â€™s â€œNo Guidance,â€ followed by a lead-act reign of his own via â€œMoney in the Grave,â€ featuring Rick Ross . Itâ€™s also Drakeâ€™s fourth nonconsecutive calendar year with at least four No. 1s, as well as his first with four or more No. 1s as a lead act since 2016. His 43rd No. 1 extends his record for the most Rhythmic Airplay toppers in the chartâ€™s 33-year history. Most No. 1s, Rhythmic Airplay: 43, Drake 17, Rihanna 16, The Weeknd 14, Chris Brown 13, Bruno Mars 13, Lil Wayne 13, Usher 12, Beyonce 12,â€¦

items.title: Ember Smart Mug 2 deal: Winter is coming, so donâ€™t let your coffee get cold!
items.summary: It'e getting cold outside, but my coffee never will!
items.body: Credit: Ember via Best Buy Today was the first time I had to wear a sweater since last winter. This means itâ€™s time for more hot drinks, and it also means they will get colder faster. Skip the pains of cold coffee sips with an Ember Smart Mug 2, which is currently $50 off! Buy the Ember Smart Mug 2 for just $99.99 ($149.95 off)

items.title: SwitchBotâ€™s new tracker could help save you from threats by sending you a ghost call
items.summary: This safety tracker has a siren that's even louder than Pebblebee's alarm.
items.body: Credit: SwitchBot TL;DR SwitchBot has launched a new tracking fob called the Safety Alarm. The tracker is a personal safety device that doubles as an NFC key and flashlight. The SwitchBot Safety Alarm is available for $39.99. Want to feel a little safer while walking alone at night? Or maybe youâ€™re looking for an easier way to unlock the door to your smart home . SwitchBot has launched a new gadget that can do both. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Android Auto might be losing access to this game collection
items.summary: GameSnacks will be missed (I guess).
items.body: TL;DR Android Auto games platform GameSnacks seems like itâ€™s being deprecated. 9to5Google has shared several user reports that the app is no longer accessible. Google is working to expand native game compatibility on Android Auto. It looks like Android Auto will soon be just a little less fun. GameSnacks, a Google-made app that contains a handful of simple games optimized for in-car displays, is seemingly being deprecated in the Android Auto beta release track, a sign that it could be shut down altogether soon. 9to5Google has shared a handful of user reports that GameSnacks is missing from the in-car app list. Itâ€™s not clear which version of the software users running into this issue have installed.

items.title: Pardoe wins athlete of the year at BBC Green Sport Awards
items.summary: Open-water swimmer Hector Pardoe, former Arsenal player Hector Bellerin and Formula E are winners at the BBC Green Sport Awards 2025.

items.title: AT&T will offer you a new phone every year for three years, but whatâ€™s the catch?
items.summary: You'll have to bundle Home Internet and cellular to qualify.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR AT&T now offers a free phone upgrade every year for three years when you bundle its home internet with wireless service. The deal includes AT&T Next Up Anytime, 20% off home internet, and up to $800 in switcher credits. New and existing customers qualify, though existing ones only get the phone upgrade benefit. As the competition over wireless customers continues to heat up between the big three, weâ€™ve seen T-Mobile begin to outshine its competitors in some ways. To combat this, Verizon and AT&T are both working hard to win new users. To that end, Verizon recently announced a new Switchers promotion , and now AT&T has something new up its sleeve as well: a free smartphone every year for three years . The catch? Youâ€™ll need to bundle AT&T home internet with cellular service. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: I can raise my voice about injustice - Bellerin
items.summary: Former Arsenal defender Hector Bellerin talks to Elizabeth Conway about his attempts to live a more sustainable life after being named global champion at the BBC Green Sport Awards.

items.title: 'With power comes responsibility' - the footballer who cycles to work
items.summary: Former Arsenal defender Hector Bellerin talks about his attempts to live a more sustainable life as he wins the BBC Green Sports Award.

items.title: World Cup 'last piece of jigsaw' for Scotland men
items.summary: Reaching next summer's World Cup is "the last piece of the jigsaw for Steve Clarke and his players", says SFA chief executive Ian Maxwell.

items.title: Earick rules out Spurs takeover bid after approach

items.title: Google may be planning to drop Samsung for the Tensor G6â€™s modem for a very good reason
items.summary: Google may move on from Samsung for the Tensor G6's modem.
items.body: Credit: Luka Mlinar / Android Authority TL;DR Google may not use a Samsung modem for its next chip. A rumor suggests that the tech giant may pick MediaTekâ€™s M90 modem instead. The reason may be that the M90 modem is faster and more energy efficient. When Google first dipped its toe into the world of semi-custom silicon development, it tapped Samsung to be its partner. After the Tensor G4, Google shook things up by switching to TSMC for the Tensor G5 (the chip in the Pixel 10 ). However, Google still turned to Samsung for the Tensor G5â€™s modem. A new rumor suggests Google could ditch Samsung completely for the next Tensor chip. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Google Japanâ€™s latest keyboard fever dream puts a new spin on rotary dialing
items.summary: Retro tech meets DIY as Google turns an old-school phone dial into a working keyboard.
items.body: TL;DR Google Japan has a long history of announcing humorous new keyboard ideas. Last year the team brought us an infinitely curving Mobius strip keyboard. This year weâ€™re going back to the days of rotary phones, with a rotary-dial keyboard. Has the Google of 2025 lost some of the spark that made the company seem like such a fun place to work in decades past? Thatâ€™s probably a fair criticism, and while it may have been an inevitability for a tech firm of this size, weâ€™re still just pleased as punch when some of that old, weird Google manages to shine through. Thatâ€™s exactly why weâ€™re as happy as we are to see the crew over at Google Japan so gleefully coming back year after year with a preposterous new keyboard design â€” and this year, they cooked up something just fantastically bizarre. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Tandy right man to coach Wales - Henson
items.summary: Gavin Henson says Steve Tandy is now the right man to lead Wales, but warns the new head coach is facing tough times.

items.title: Rangers 'did not get this right' with Martin
items.summary: Rangers say they "did not get this right" with Russell Martin's appointment and have started a "rigorous" recruitment drive to replace the head coach.

items.title: Rangers 'did not get Martin appointment right' with 'rigorous' recruitment under way
items.summary: Rangers say they "did not get this right" with Russell Martin's appointment and have started a "rigorous" recruitment drive to replace the head coach.

items.title: Brits inspires SA to six-wicket victory over New Zealand
items.summary: Tamzin Brits' century helps South Africa bounce back from their 10-wicket defeat against England with a comfortable six-wicket victory over New Zealand in the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup.

items.title: England squad strength 'ridiculous' - Wales boss Bellamy
items.summary: Craig Bellamy says England's squad depth is so impressive that a boxing promoter would not pair them against his Wales side.

items.title: England squad strength 'ridiculous' - Bellamy
items.summary: Craig Bellamy says England's squad depth is so impressive that a boxing promoter would not pair them against his Wales side.

items.title: The Kane-inspired tactic undoing Barcelona
items.summary: Barcelona have lost their latest two games and there is a Harry Kane-inspired tactical tweak that teams are using to disrupt their defence this season.

items.title: Kogan appointed independent football regulator amid enquiry
items.summary: Sports media rights executive David Kogan is appointed as the first chair of English football's new independent regulator.

items.title: 'The most wonderful human' - Greenwood leads support for Moody after MND diagnosis
items.summary: Friend and former team-mate Will Greenwood backs Lewis Moody after the ex-England captain reveals he has motor neurone disease.

items.title: Brits century helps SA respond to England crushing
items.summary: Tazmin Brits' sublime century helps South Africa bounce back from their heavy defeat by England with a six-wicket win over New Zealand in the Women's World Cup.

items.title: Champion McLaughlin 'ready' for Formula 3 step
items.summary: British F4 champion Fionn McLaughlin believes he is "ready" to make the step up to race in Formula 3 in 2026.

items.title: Is Martin worst Rangers boss ever? What do the numbers say?
items.summary: BBC Scotland crunches the numbers behind Russell Martin's calamitous four-month tenure and looks at who Rangers could turn to next.

items.title: Norrie out in Shanghai Masters third round
items.summary: Britain's Cameron Norrie is left to rue missed opportunities as he is beaten by rising teenage star Learner Tien in the Shanghai Masters third round.

items.title: Luton sack Bloomfield after nine months in charge
items.summary: Luton Town sack manager Matt Bloomfield with the club 11th in the League One table.

items.title: Google Maps Timeline error leaves users unable to access location history
items.summary: Google Maps users report being unable to transfer Timeline data to their phone.
items.body: Credit: Andy Walker / Android Authority TL;DR Google Maps users are reporting an error when attempting to transfer their Timeline data to their phone. The issue is preventing users from accessing their location history. A potential workaround involves using another account logged into Maps, but this solution wonâ€™t allow the user to fully restore or consolidate their Timeline. If youâ€™ve been having trouble transferring your Google Maps Timeline data to your phone, youâ€™re not alone. Users are encountering an error thatâ€™s preventing access to the data. There appears to be a workaround, but itâ€™s far from being a perfect solution. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Googleâ€™s ready to pay up to $20,000 if you can break Gemini very, very badly
items.summary: You'll have to do a lot worse than just embarrass Gemini to get these bug bounties.
items.body: TL;DR Google shares new bug bounty details for AI with its Vulnerability Reward Program. The most dangerous exploits can score their finders up to $20,000. Itâ€™s not nice to be a bully. At least, not to people . But for a certain segment of AI â€œfans,â€ thereâ€™s nothing more fun than ganging up on an AI chatbot and trying to get it to do basically anything other than whatâ€™s intended. That can include hallucinating wildly incorrect answers , or even convincing the bot to ignore restrictions that its creators have tried to enforce. And now if youâ€™re good enough at breaking AI bots in epic fashion, Google might just be willing to pay you for it. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Retiring Waerea-Hargreaves set to miss Grand Final
items.summary: Hull KR prop Jared Waerea-Hargreaves is set to miss Saturday's Grand Final against Wigan after receiving a three-match ban.

items.title: Depay late for Dutch duty after passport stolen
items.summary: Netherlands forward Memphis Depay will be late for international duty because his passport was stolen in Brazil, where he plays for Corinthians.

items.title: Your next phone might come without a USB cable
items.summary: After ditching bundled charging bricks, manufacturers might drop USB cables next.
items.body: TL;DR A post on Reddit shows the Sony Xperia 10 VII doesnâ€™t include a USB cable in the box. Smartphones typically donâ€™t come with chargers anymore, but cables are still standard. We expect more manufacturers to follow suit in the near future. Apple made waves with 2020â€™s iPhone 12, the first major smartphone to ship without an included charging brick. Appleâ€™s public rationale was that USB chargers had become ubiquitous by then, and so no longer including them with every new device could conserve resources and reduce e-waste without causing much inconvenience for consumers. Since then, other major OEMs have done the same â€” smartphones that do include chargers have become the exception. Now, it looks like we may be in for a similar shift with bundled USB cables. As shared on the Linus Tech Tips subreddit, user Brick_Fish â€˜s recently purchased Sony Xperia 10 VII came without a charger or a charging cable. In a photo included with the post, you can see iconography on the back of the phoneâ€™s box that spells out these omissions. Sonyâ€™s not really a major player in the smartphone space these days, but this seems like the type of trend we should expect to see gain traction over the next câ€¦

items.title: Scrutiny on us can only be good - England's Dean
items.summary: Spinner Charlie Dean reflects on the increased scrutiny England faced after a difficult winter and looks ahead to their second World Cup game against Bangladesh.

items.title: Red Roses winning back-to-back World Cups is RFU growth goal
items.summary: The Rugby Football Union has challenged the Red Roses to become the first England team to defend a Rugby World Cup as part of its women's game growth strategy.

items.title: One UI 8 brings some nice UI improvements to Galaxy tablets
items.summary: One UI 8 refines the tablet experience with smart layout changes for Clock and Calendar apps.
items.body: TL;DR One UI 8 is now rolling out to selected Samsung tablets, including the Galaxy Tab S10 Plus. The update improves app layouts for large screens, such as relocating clock controls to a side pane. A redesigned Calendar app features a resizable agenda view, providing quicker access to daily events. One of the best parts of One UI is how well it works on big screens. Samsung adds a lot of features to its tablets and foldables that make them more productive, and One UI 8 , which is rolling out to several tablets, including our Galaxy Tab S10 Plus , brings some nice changes to Samsungâ€™s apps that make using them on a large screen more pleasant. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Pixel fans are done forgiving Tensorâ€™s underwhelming performance and efficiency
items.summary: Many of our readers are frustrated with Tensor, and many feel Google is serving budget performance at flagship prices.
items.body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR Googleâ€™s in-house Tensor chips are facing heavy criticism from fans for their subpar performance and poor battery life. Readers feel that Google Pixels, which are priced as flagships, largely lack the performance to justify the price tag. While some fans appreciate the AI features and software integration of the chip, many believe that its flaws outweigh its benefits. The recently launched Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 looks promising on paper, and Qualcomm seems poised for another successful year, securing its place among top Android flagships once again. Despite its dominance, itâ€™s looking unlikely that a Snapdragon SoC will make its way to a Google Pixel flagship anytime soon, and my colleague C. Scott Brown is actually glad that Pixels donâ€™t use Snapdragon . Much like he predicted, this opinion was highly controversial, and it seems a lot of our readers are done forgiving Tensor for its mediocrity. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Cosmic Orange envy? New dbrand skin turns your Pixel 10 iPhone-orange
items.summary: What looks like a Pixel, and works like a Pixel, but is iPhone-colored?
items.body: TL;DR Appleâ€™s new iPhone 17 Pro models include a â€œCosmic Orangeâ€ color options thatâ€™s been hugely popular. Now dbrand is giving Android users a chance to get in on the fun with a new set of skins. The drband Cosmic Orange skins are available for the Pixel 10, Galaxy S25 Ultra, Switch 2, and more. In the smartphone world, a little bit of jealousy can be a good thing. After all, we donâ€™t want any of our favorite phone brands getting too complacent, and for as much as we might love the new model we just took home, sometimes a competitor is doing just enough right to have us wishing we couldnâ€™t have the best of both worlds. This yearâ€™s new Pixel 10 phones arrived with some alluring color options available, including that deep-blue Indigo shade that might be our current favorite. But even thatâ€™s not stopping some Pixel fans from feeling a little iPhone envy. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: T-Mobile will soon begin phasing out LTE in favor of 5G
items.summary: It seems T-Mobile may soon begin phashing out LTE in favor of 5G, with most of the LTE network offline by 2028.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR A leaked internal document suggests T-Mobile will re-farm LTE spectrum bands for 5G use in the near future. LTE service will gradually degrade, with most of it shut down by 2028 and full deactivation expected by 2035. Starting January 2026, only 5G SA-compatible devices will be allowed for new activations without an exception. Anyone who has been around the block a few times has likely seen what happens when a carrier rolls out a new wireless technology. At first, it coexists with older standards, but over time, those older standards are gradually shut down as their spectrum is re-farmed to keep the network evolving. Weâ€™ve already experienced major transitions with the shutdowns of both 2G and 3G. Things are a little different today, as LTE and 5G are quite distinct in theory but often similar in real-world performance. Still, it appears LTEâ€™s days are numbered, at least for those on the T-Mobile network. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: WHO tobacco trends report: 1 in 5 adults still addicted to tobacco
items.summary: The world is smoking less, but the tobacco epidemic is far from over. A new WHO global report shows the number of tobacco users has dropped from 1.38 billion in 2000 to 1.2 billion in 2024. Since 2010, the number of people using tobacco has dropped by 120 million â€“ a 27% drop in relative terms. Yetâ€¦

items.title: Verizonâ€™s new promo uses AI to allegedly give you a better deal than T-Mobile or AT&T
items.summary: Verizon is taking aim at AT&T and T-Mobile customers with a new promo that aims to get you a better deal with Big Red.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Verizon is trying to shed its â€œpremium-priceâ€ image by launching a new promotion aimed directly at AT&T and T-Mobile customers. Itâ€™s new AI-powered â€œBring your billâ€ tool analyzes rival bills and applies comparable pricing and promotional credits to match or beat them. The matched rates are locked for 36 months, but prices will rise afterward, making it a short-term value play rather than a permanent discount. Verizon has a well-earned reputation for solid network performance, but at a much higher price than the competition. Over the last few years, this has changed a bit as T-Mobile has become a major leader in 5G and beyond. The truth is that all three major carriers now offer fairly similar features and performance overall, though it ultimately depends on where you live. What really sets carriers the most is quickly becoming price and value. Thatâ€™s not an area that Big Red usually excels at, but with its newest promotion , itâ€™s promising to get more competitive here than ever before. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: A major brand is teasing a â€˜hybrid phoneâ€™ and we have questions
items.summary: Leaks suggest we're looking at a feature phone with a touchscreen.
items.body: Credit: HMD Global TL;DR HMD has teased the arrival of a so-called â€œhybrid phone,â€ called the HMD Touch 4G. Leaked images and a video suggest that this is a feature phone with a touchscreen. This wouldnâ€™t be the first feature phone with a touch-enabled display, but HMD is no stranger to feature phones, as itâ€™s offered dirt-cheap feature phones and KaiOS-powered smart feature phones over the years. However, the company has started to tease the HMD Touch 4G, which it claims is a â€œhybrid phone.â€ Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: I didnâ€™t realize how much Iâ€™d miss Samsung Routines until I switched to a Pixel
items.summary: Samsung Routines vs. Pixel Rules? It's no contest.
items.body: I recently switched from a Galaxy S24 Ultra to a Pixel 10 Pro , and of the things I miss about One UI , Samsung Routines has ranked higher than I expected. Pixels have â€œRulesâ€ buried deep in the settings menu, and they donâ€™t hold a candle to the flexibility and usefulness that Samsung Routines provides users. I want a phone that can do things for me without my intervention, and with features like At A Glance and Now Playing, the Pixel is one of the best phones at doing that, which only makes Pixel Rules feel more disappointing.

items.title: I found an Android launcher that combines the best of Niagara and Nova Launcher
items.summary: Everyone, meet Mur Launcher.
items.body: Credit: Tushar Mehta / Android Authority About 15 years ago, when I first switched from a Nokia to an Android phone, it wasnâ€™t a mere choice; it was also a financial decision. I couldnâ€™t afford to buy an iPhone, and its price, padded with hefty import fees, made it a dream I refused to approach. Over the years, I became more fascinated with Androidâ€™s customization. A decade and a half later, I consciously stick to Android phones. While my attempts at heavily modding my phones or fiddling with custom ROMs have decreased significantly, there are two things I still actively do: change wallpapers routinely and switch to a new launcher every few weeks or months, actively hopping between multiple awesome launchers on Android .

items.title: Samsung Galaxy S22 is getting its fourth and final major Android update
items.summary: With One UI 8 based on Android 16.
items.body: Credit: Lanh Nguyen / Android Authority TL;DR One UI 8 has begun to roll out to Galaxy S22 series phones. This is the fourth and likely final update for the Galaxy S22 series. We cannot confidently say whether One UI 8.5 will arrive on the Galaxy S22 or not. The One UI 8 update train is pushing ahead at full steam, and thereâ€™s no stopping it. In a matter of a few weeks, Samsung has rolled out the update to the last three generations of flagship bar phones and foldable devices, along with some tablets and affordable A-series phones. Now, itâ€™s trickling down deeper and reaching the Galaxy S22 series , which started to receive its first One UI 8 update. The stable One UI 8 update has arrived for the Galaxy S22, S22 Plus, and S22 Ultra, as highlighted by noted Samsung tipster Tarun Varun on an X post . It weighs in at about 3.2GB and upgrades the Android version to 16. The update is available to a user in Turkey, so a global rollout can be expected to follow soon.

items.title: Are 'exciting' Man Utd WSL title contenders?
items.summary: The Women's Football Show pundits Fern Whelan & Nia Jones discuss whether Manchester United are Women's Super League title contenders.

items.title: The pocket-friendly OnePlus 15T could almost defy physics with a giant battery
items.summary: Thought the OnePlus 13s had a huge battery? The OnePlus 15T or OnePlus 15s could up the ante in a big way.
items.body: Credit: Aamir Siddiqui / Android Authority TL;DR A leaker has revealed more purported details about the rumored OnePlus 15T smartphone. The phone is said to retain a similarly small screen size as its predecessor, while bringing a 7,000mAh+ battery. The OnePlus 15T will likely be called the OnePlus 15s if itâ€™s released outside China. OnePlus launched the OnePlus 13T in China earlier this year (known as the OnePlus 13s in India), and itâ€™s one of the few pocket-friendly Android phones on the market. Weâ€™ve heard murmurs of a successor, and a leaker has now revealed plenty more apparent features. Weibo leaker Smart Pikachu has revealed a variety of purported details about the OnePlus 15T, which will likely be the OnePlus 15s if it launches outside China. For starters, the phone is said to have a 6.3-inch screen size and a Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 chipset.

items.title: Are T-Mobile and other carriers spying on you?
items.summary: No, your carriers aren't actually watching you â€” but they do have access to a lot of personal data.
items.body: Recently, a Redditor with the username toastedsausageman shared a letter they claimed to have received by snail mail from T-Mobile. The letter alleged that their account had been involved in accessing websites hosting questionable material, including â€œsites promoting hacking activitiesâ€ or â€œfeaturing fictional characters presented as underageâ€. The post immediately sparked debate over whether this was a phishing scam or simply a karma-farming attempt, though many users chimed in to say they had received similar letters. Adding to the intrigue, the source email appeared to be legitimate, as the same address is referenced in an unrelated official court document .

items.title: 5 journaling apps you should use instead of Pixel Journal
items.summary: Googleâ€™s journal app might be a Pixel-exclusive, but that doesnâ€™t mean itâ€™s the best out there.
items.body: Google rolled out a set of exclusive apps for the Pixel 10 smartphone line, including a new personal reflection app called Pixel Journal . Iâ€™ve already covered it in a separate article, but to summarize, itâ€™s an AI-enhanced diary app that offers contextual writing prompts, support for attached images and maps, and is designed using Googleâ€™s new Material 3 Expressive design language. Naturally, it seems like a perfect fit for Pixel users. However, Google didnâ€™t invent the diary app. In fact, plenty of other journal apps have existed on the platform for years, each offering something a little different. If you arenâ€™t impressed by Pixel Journalâ€™s AI features, find it overwhelming, or donâ€™t think it delves deep enough, here are some apps you should consider instead.

items.title: Mark your calendars: Android 16 is finally coming to OnePlus flagships
items.summary: Expect deeper Gemini integration into key Oxygen OS features like Mind Space.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR OnePlus announced that its Android 16-based Oxygen OS 16 update will launch on October 16, 2025. The new platform update will feature Gemini integration, allowing the AI to access content saved in Mind Space for recall and further building up. Android 16 has been out for several months for Pixel users, weeks for several Galaxy and (surprisingly) Motorola and Sony users , but nowhere to be found for the rest of the Android gang. The abysmally slow rollout of Android 16 leaves a bad taste in the mouth, especially when you glance over to the other side of the fence and see every single currently supported Apple device already receiving the latest update. Thankfully, it seems the Android crew is finally pulling up, as OnePlus has now announced that Oxygen OS 16 is coming this month. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Google is confusing Home users with Nest Aware and Google One plan changes
items.summary: Changes to bundling of different plans is confusing the hell out of users.
items.body: Credit: Stephen Schenck / Android Authority TL;DR Googleâ€™s newly added Home Premium subscription is set to replace existing Nest Aware plans by next year. While Google prompts users to upgrade, the poorly worded messaging fails to effectively convey the benefits. Meanwhile, in the UK, Google will de-bundle the Fitbit Premium and Nest Aware plans from Google One next year, effectively doubling the cost for users there. Gemini recently arrived on Google Home, bringing a conversational interface to the platform . This updated interface allows you to ask questions or let Gemini scour through security camera footage for you, eliminating the need for manual labor. The best features, such as Ask Home and Home Brief, of the newly introduced Google Home experience, unfortunately, require a subscription . The Standard and Advanced tiers of the newly introduced Google Home Premium subscription replace the existing Nest Aware and Aware Plus monthly plans. And with this, Google is asking some users to pay more than they are used to.

OpenAI and former Apple designer Jony Ive announced work on a mysterious new AI device last year, and weâ€™ve heard a few details since then. Furthermore, the outletâ€™s sources say these issues could delay the deviceâ€™s release. However, one source said these problems were typical of the product development process.

items.title: Samsungâ€™s Galaxy Ring just exposed my biggest smart ring fear
items.summary: I may have ten fingers, but I like all of them.
items.body: Smart rings are small, discreet, and stay out of the way while logging heart rate , sleep patterns, and more. But when something goes wrong, that convenience can quickly turn into a liability. A Galaxy Ring user recently reported that his ringâ€™s battery swelled while on his finger, making removal impossible without hospital intervention. More than just nightmare fuel, the incident highlights a design flaw across the entire industry. Smart rings, for all their promise, lack an emergency exit. Trapped by my own tech Credit: Kaitlyn Cimino / Android Authority Unlike watches or bands, rings donâ€™t unbuckle (or un-Velcro) for easy removal. They only come off the way they go on: sliding past knuckles. If a finger swells, whether from heat, hydration, or a malfunctioning battery, the device can quickly become a vise. In the case of one unlucky Galaxy Ring user , battery swelling turned a well-fitting device into a finger trap, grounding his flight plans and sending him to the ER. The fear of having a ring of any kind stuck on my finger is very real. Thatâ€™s exactly what happened to tech creator Daniel (@ZONEofTECH). According to Daniel, after his Galaxy Ringâ€™s battery failed, soap and handâ€¦

items.title: I tested ChatGPTâ€™s new Sora 2 model against Googleâ€™s Veo 3, and the difference is astounding
items.summary: Google had a mammoth lead in AI video generation, but OpenAI has upended that status quo.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority If you buy a Pixel 10 Pro series phone, or even last yearâ€™s Pixel 9 Pro, you get one full yearâ€™s worth of Googleâ€™s Gemini Pro subscription. This $20-per-month service unlocks the powerful Gemini 2.5 Pro model and a suite of cutting-edge AI tools. Until very recently, the crown jewel of this package was Veo 3, Googleâ€™s impressive text-to-video generator that could turn any description into a hyper-realistic short video. But the AI world moves at lightning speed. This past week, OpenAI announced its competing Sora 2 model, meaning Googleâ€™s video generator is no longer the only game in town. While Sora 2 is invite-only for now, the model already has an active user base. So naturally, I took OpenAIâ€™s Sora 2 for a spin vs Googleâ€™s Veo 3 to find out which AI video generator has the upper hand.

items.title: The Pixel 10 Pro Fold is great, but I am sticking to this instead
items.summary: The Pixel 10 Pro Fold is a big leap for Google, but vivoâ€™s X Fold 5 wins with better cameras, battery, and hardware.
items.body: Slim might be the flavor of the season, but thereâ€™s no denying that the best foldable phones are the pinnacle of modern smartphone engineering prowess and design. These smartphones push the very idea of form factors and what a phone can do, with a focus on portable productivity, and give us an obvious glimpse at where the future of computing might lead. Simply put, foldables are basically every smartphone companyâ€™s opportunity to innovate and flex. In fact, itâ€™s the one smartphone category that still feels fresh to me despite the first foldable phone releasing almost six years ago. Foldables are the one smartphone category that still feel fresh to me despite the first foldable phone releasing almost six years ago. Itâ€™s also why the Pixel 10 Pro Fold matters so much, despite being relatively late to the game, Apple notwithstanding. Google controls Android, so its approach to foldables sets expectations for how the platform should evolve. While the phone is yet to be released, weâ€™ve had an opportunity to spend some time with the Pixel 10 Pro Fold, and its clear that Google has corrected some obvious mistakes from its first attempt. Compared to the Pixel 9 Pro Fold , the cover displaâ€¦

Iâ€™m still reading myself to sleep, but in a decidedly more grounded bed and with far more Kindle know-how. I always save a certain percentage of my income for a rainy day, invest regularly for the future, and try to stay on top of all the latest news on the financial markets to spot short-term opportunities. However, the road to achieving my financial goals is long and unpredictable, so I take any help I can get. I regularly rely on five apps that help me on my journey and have proven to be invaluable. Hereâ€™s why. YNAB

items.title: 7 â€œfactsâ€ about Android that are no longer true in 2025
items.summary: From performance to cameras, there are some facts about Android devices that simply aren't true anymore.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority The Android landscape has made major strides since the first Android phones over 15 years ago. The early versions of Android didnâ€™t even have features like multi-touch input, copy-and-paste, or auto-rotate! Many nuggets of Android wisdom have been passed down over the years. But things change, and itâ€™s fair to say that some previous facts and assumptions about Android and Android devices are no longer true.

items.title: How Google plans to fix its smart home mess with Gemini for Google Home
items.summary: Google acknowledges the frustrations people have with its Google Home ecosystem but thinks it can win back trust with Gemini
items.body: The original promise of smart speakers was to revolutionize our daily lives by shifting tasks from manual input on our phones and computers to simple, hands-free voice commands. However, they largely failed to live up to this promise. In fact, some smart speakers, including those in Googleâ€™s Home ecosystem , have even seen a significant decline in reliability. This decline raises the question of what, if anything, tech companies are doing to reverse the trend. Googleâ€™s answer is to bring its Gemini AI into the smart home. Unveiled this week, Gemini for Home upgrades the conversational experience in Google Home smart speakers, displays, doorbells, and cameras with AI, while also introducing smarter media controls, improved alerts, and more intelligent search capabilities.

items.title: The Pixel 10 Proâ€™s 100x zoom is way too good, with one caveat
items.summary: Great looking photo you took there, but is it real?
items.body: What is a photo? I see that question on my timeline more and more, and as phone makers begin to introduce AI-enhanced photos, the question is valid. When Google announced 100x Pro Res Zoom on its new Pixel 10 Pro lineup â€” which uses AI to enhance a very digitally-zoomed-in photo â€” that question of what makes a photo a photo rang loudly in my mind. Does it really matter how the photo is created if you like the end result and it looks like what itâ€™s supposed to look like? Well, that depends, and weâ€™ll get to that, but first letâ€™s dive in and take a look at what this 100x zoom looks like in real-life use. As far as the eye can seeâ€¦and then some I was shocked the first time I scrolled all the way to the right on the zoom slider, snapped my photo, then watched the sparkles dance around on my screen as Googleâ€™s artificial intelligence worked to recreate and enhance what I only saw as a grainy, pixelated scene on my screen. Within a few moments, the dancing pixels dissolved to reveal the final result: an incredibly detailed and very accurate photograph of a scene that I could hardly see with my own eyes. Consider me mind-blown. That moment truly felt shocking.

items.title: Androidâ€™s new Computer Control feature shows the Rabbit R1 was ahead of its time
items.summary: Google is working on a Computer Control feature that will let you automate Android apps. Here's how.
items.body: For a brief period last year, it seemed that AI-powered gadgets like the Rabbit R1 were going to be the next big thing. People were fascinated by the idea of replacing their smartphones with tiny wearable boxes they could talk to, but unfortunately, these gadgets failed to live up to the hype. They failed for a variety of reasons â€” like price, redundancy, and utility â€” but the seeds they planted for a future of fully automated apps stuck around. These seeds grew into the â€œagentic AIâ€ trend we see today. Companies are racing to build AI products that can perform tasks on your behalf, like helping you code a new project, booking an appointment, or ordering items online. As one of the leaders in the AI race, Google is also working on its own AI agents, with Gemini in Chrome being its most notable offering.

Scott Brown dive into a treasure trove of One UI 8.5 leaks, revealing a slew of new features potentially coming to the Samsung Galaxy S26, including a new â€œprivate displayâ€ mode. They also discuss Googleâ€™s work on an Apple Handoff competitor for Android and evidence that a hypertension alert system is coming to the Pixel Watch. The Authority Insights Podcast is a new weekly show from the Android Authority team hosted by Mishaal Rahman and C. Scott Brown. In each episode, weâ€™ll break down the latest exclusive reports, app teardowns, and leaks from the Android Authority team.

items.title: Itâ€™s been 3 months, and Nothingâ€™s Glyph Matrix still feels like a gimmick
items.summary: A broken compass is right, well, not very often.
items.body: I like to think that I was cautiously optimistic when Nothing swapped from the line-based Glyph Interface to the dot-based Glyph Matrix with the launch of its Phone 3 . In reality, though, I was mostly just cautious. I was worried that in trying to make its iconic LED lights do even more, Nothing would wind up with another attractive but ultimately useless gimmick â€” kind of like its pseudo-transparent back panels. And, now that itâ€™s been a few months, I feel like I was right. Nothingâ€™s toybox is growing, but itâ€™s still pretty empty

items.title: I canâ€™t believe everyone loves NotebookLM this much when it lacks such a crucial feature
items.summary: NotebookLM skips over graphs, drawings, and flowcharts â€” the exact context I often need.
items.body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority For the past few months, itâ€™s been NotebookLM this and NotebookLM that . Googleâ€™s AI tool has captured the interest of anyone who deals with numerous large documents and files, becoming essential for thousands of students, lawyers, marketers, and more. We even use it here on Android Authority to make some of our internal guides interactive. Just ask a question and get the answer straight from the documentation. NotebookLM is fantastic for that. Itâ€™s a powerful search tool, study buddy, and assistant in one. Plus, it doesnâ€™t hallucinate like other AI tools trained on quasi-infinite data; it just uses the sources you give it, so you know youâ€™ll be getting a proper answer. My problem with it is that it hides the source away when itâ€™s a PDF file, and that really limits its usefulness for anything other than text.

items.title: My favorite Spotify feature makes other music apps completely useless in the car
items.summary: Spotify Jam is the Android Auto feature my road trips needed the most.
items.body: There are many reasons why I still choose Spotify over other music streaming services , and Iâ€™m aware that some readers think Iâ€™m crazy â€” but hear me out. Iâ€™ve already mentioned why Spotify Duo is perfect for my household, and then thereâ€™s Spotify Connect, which lets me control music on my PS4 and other devices through my phone. Iâ€™ve also grown accustomed to the playlists it generates for me, many of which reliably contain great tracks. However, perhaps the biggest reason I stick with Spotify is its collaborative queue editing feature, Spotify Jam. Our household often listens to music selected spontaneously rather than from a set playlist. So, when my partner wants to add a track to my queue or me to hers, we can join a Jam and start rearranging and adding tracks as we please. Naturally, this feature is a household favorite and a strong reason we rely on Spotify, and recently, the feature got even better.

items.title: The real reasons more people donâ€™t switch to prepaid service over the big three carriers
items.summary: Concerns about performance, phone selection, and confusion over an abudance of options are just a few common reasons.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority Itâ€™s 2025, and more people are finally getting on board with prepaid, largely because of ever-increasing prices and broken promises from the Big Three carriers. Still, Iâ€™m sure we all know a few holdouts, or you might be one yourself. A little over a year ago, I argued that prepaid was a better option for many people, and that reluctance to switch was driven by persistent myths . Many of those points still hold, but awareness has improved, and so has prepaid market penetration. When you remove some of the most common myths from the equation, what are the real reasons people still donâ€™t switch to prepaid? I dug into the most common ones I hear from friends, family, and online communities. Here are the biggest reasons some people say prepaid isnâ€™t worth the switch. We also look a bit deeper at how valid these reasons are in reality.

items.title: Poll results: These apps are your favorite Spotify alternatives
items.summary: Android Authority readers really like YouTube Music.
items.body: Spotify is the first name in music streaming, but from an increasingly jam-packed app interface to concerns about artist payout and leadership conduct , itâ€™s not hard to come up with reasons a music fan might want to consider other options. Itâ€™s a crowded field, filled with heavy-hitting alternatives like YouTube Music, Tidal, Deezer, and more. In a recent poll , we asked which of a few other apps you prefer â€” and thereâ€™s a clear winner. Given the choice between Bandcamp, Deezer, SoundCloud, Tidal, and YouTube Music, Googleâ€™s music app came out ahead by a wide margin. Nearly half of survey respondents preferred YouTube Music â€” taking out the â€œotherâ€ option, YouTube Music got more votes than all the other options in our survey combined.

items.title: Samsungâ€™s One UI 8.5 update is an even bigger deal than you thought
items.summary: One UI 8.5 will be based on Android 16 QPR2, bringing several major new Android features to Galaxy devices.
items.body: TL;DR Leaked builds show Samsungâ€™s next One UI 8.5 update, debuting with the Galaxy S26, will be based on Android 16â€™s second quarterly release (QPR2). This is significant because most device makers skip quarterly Android updates, delaying new features until the next major annual version is released. By adopting QPR2, Samsung can bring new Android platform features to Galaxy devices much faster than before, matching Googleâ€™s own release cadence. Weâ€™re still over 3 months away from the expected unveiling of the Samsung Galaxy S26 series, but we already know many of its new software tricks thanks to a trove of One UI 8.5 leaks . Leaked builds of the software have surfaced, giving us a rare opportunity to see what Samsung is developing for its next major release. As its name suggests, One UI 8.5 will be based on this yearâ€™s Android 16 release, not the yet-to-be-released Android 17 . However, it will differ from its predecessor. While One UI 8 was based on the initial stable release of Android 16, One UI 8.5 will be built upon the second quarterly platform release, Android 16 QPR2.

items.title: Exclusive first look: This is the canceled Google Pixel 4 5G
items.summary: We finally know what 'needlefish' was intended to be.
items.body: TL;DR Photos of the Google Pixel â€œneedlefishâ€ have leaked online. Once rumored to be a Pixel 4 family member, the device sported a Snapdragon 855 with an X55 modem and 8GB of RAM. Itâ€™s likely the device was merely a tool for Google to evaluate and learn about 5G before more mature hardware was available. The Google Pixel series is notoriously prone to leaks. Typically, we know everything about the next Pixel phones months before their announcement, but occasionally, the odd rumored device never arrives, leaving us with a mystery. This was the case with the canceled first-gen Pixel Fold, codenamed â€œpipit,â€ for example, until we showcased what it was last year. Another of these mysteries is the alleged third flagship Pixel 4 device, codenamed â€œneedlefish.â€ There were many theories about what it could be, but we had never seen any concrete details, until now. Thanks to a photo leak and our sources, weâ€™ve managed to get to the bottom of what the mysterious handset was.

items.title: YouTube Premium supports switching profiles, and itâ€™s a total game changer for Music
items.summary: I used this free Google account trick to stop ruining my YouTube algorithm with music.
items.body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority One of the most common complaints I keep reading from YouTube Music users is that Google treats it and their regular YouTube experience as one and the same. If you like one artistâ€™s songs, youâ€™re now subscribed to their videos as well. If you listen to or search for some music, itâ€™s now part of your YouTube recommendations as well. For the few people who solely (or mostly) use YouTube to watch music videos, thatâ€™s fine. But most people have more varied interests than just music videos and end up with an odd mix of two experiences that shouldnâ€™t be merged. Me? I donâ€™t watch music videos at all, so seeing any YouTube Music content in my regular YouTube feels like unwanted clutter that I have to weed through. Having my video subscriptions littered with artists and bands led me to cull most of my liked artists on Music, then ditch it altogether for Spotifyâ€™s more powerful featureset . Then, one day, I realized I was sitting on the perfect cure for that annoying YouTube overlap: multiple channels.

items.title: I finally switched to a standalone password manager and it wasnâ€™t as painful as I expected
items.summary: I thought the switch would disrupt my workflow, but it went quite smoothly.
items.body: For years I relied on Chromeâ€™s built-in password manager thanks to its convenience. Even as more appealing solutions emerged, I hesitated to make the switch to a standalone password manager. But in September, I finally switched over to Proton Pass. I expected it to be a bumpy transition, however â€” besides a few quirks â€” the change wasnâ€™t disruptive at all.

items.title: Strava sues Garmin over key fitness features you probably rely on
items.summary: Strava believes that Garmin is infringing on several of its patents.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR Strava is suing Garmin for allegedly infringing on several patents. These patents are primarily related to segments and heatmaps. Strava wants Garmin to cease offering products that utilize these patents. Even the strongest partnerships face challenges occasionally, and thatâ€™s certainly the case with two fitness industry giants. Fitness platform Strava is suing hardware maker and one of its biggest partners, Garmin, over alleged patent infringements. Strava also wants Garmin to stop selling products that may utilize these patents, which would include a slew of its fitness watches, cycling computers, and the Garmin Connect app. The lawsuit, first reported by fitness industry veteran DC Rainmaker , focuses on two primary features utilized by both companies: segments and heatmaps. Segments allow users to compete against others and themselves within sections of a given route. Breaking down longer routes encourages users to hit more manageable targets across a more extended training session or race. Heatmaps, meanwhile, display areas and routes that users traffic heavily, effectively highlighting popular training areas. This is an excellentâ€¦

items.title: YouTube TV took NBCUniversal spat public, but thereâ€™s good news (Update: Better news)
items.summary: Update: Following news of a short-term extension, NBCUniversal has announced a new long-term deal with Google.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google has announced that itâ€™s reached a short-term extension with NBCUniversal for content on YouTube TV. This news comes a week after Google said it failed to reach an agreement and that this content could be removed after September 30. NBCUniversal has subsequently announced a new long-term deal for YouTube TV. Update: October 3, 2025 (5:12 AM ET): NBCUniversal has announced that itâ€™s reached a new long-term deal with Google for content on YouTube TV. The deal means YouTube TV will offer NBCUniversalâ€™s â€œfull portfolioâ€ of channels. The deal doesnâ€™t end here, as NBCUniversal says the new NBC Sports Network channel will also be available to YouTube TV subscribers later in the fall. Furthermore, the content provider confirmed that Peacock will be available via YouTube Primetime Channels.

items.title: This simple change could make Gemini Scheduled Actions a joy to use (APK teardown)
items.summary: The smallest addition is bringing massive value for Scheduled Actions users.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR Google is preparing a small but significant change to Geminiâ€™s Scheduled Actions feature. The new tweak allows users to edit actions within the Gemini app, including the prompt, the name of the action, and the run conditions. Previously, users would be required to visit the web portal to administer any tweaks. Google rolled out Scheduled Actions for Gemini in June, allowing users to trigger tasks at a specific time of the day automatically. This was a boon for those who create daily digests and want them to run without intervention. However, there was one small problem: these actions were a nightmare to edit. Thanks to a small but significant change, Google is making it much easier to edit Scheduled Actions directly from the Gemini app.

items.title: Not enough package thieves to train your AI? Just pay users to act it out
items.summary: Fake it 'til you train it: Why eufy's plan to stage thefts went viral.
items.body: TL;DR Anker brand eufy solicited its camera users to submit footage of crime to help train its AI systems. Users could get $2 per approved clip, maxing out at $40 per camera. If they didnâ€™t have enough crime happening around them, eufy encouraged users to film themselves pretending to be package thieves. Itâ€™s sometimes difficult to remember, especially when weâ€™re confronted with all the incredibly impressive feats it can pull off, that AI, despite the â€œintelligenceâ€ in its name, is still profoundly dumb. At least, it doesnâ€™t have any real understanding of concepts, and only manages to give the impression that it does because it is so very, very good at matching patterns . Getting that good requires a lot of training, which is one of the biggest expenses faced by the companies building these models. And this week weâ€™re learning about a clever way one company looked to crowdsource an effort like that â€” even if it cut a few corners along the way. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: We finally know how Androidâ€™s new app verification rules will actually work
items.summary: Google has revealed many new details about Androidâ€™s new developer verification requirements.
items.body: TL;DR Starting next year, Android will block the installation of apps from unverified developers, a policy that affects both Play Store and sideloaded apps. The new system requires Android to check if a developer is verified, which in some cases will necessitate an active internet connection during installation. Hobbyist developers can get a free account but will face strict distribution limits, requiring them to manually authorize each device installing their app. Back in August, Google made an announcement that shocked Android enthusiasts and privacy advocates: Starting next year, Android will block the installation of apps from unverified developers . This applies not only to apps on the Play Store but also to apps distributed outside of it, sparking concern that Google wants to kill sideloading . After a few weeks of silence, Google finally addressed these concerns, insisting that sideloading is here to stay. The company also shared new details about how its developer verification requirements will be enforced, including that, in some cases, Android will require an active network connection to sideload apps. Last month, we spotted evidence in the Android SDK suggesting developâ€¦

items.title: New rules take flight: Why your power bank may be grounded next time you fly
items.summary: Here's what you need to know about taking a power bank with you on flight.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Some popular airline companies have recently changed their rules around power banks. On some airlines, youâ€™ll no longer be able to use or charge any kind of power bank while in the cabin. The rule change is in response to the growing number of power bank incidents. The thought of being stuck on a flight with nothing to keep you entertained is a nightmare. Thatâ€™s why many travelers tend to bring power banks with them, so their devices stay juiced up as they move from point A to point B. But the next time you plan a trip, be sure to check the rules on power banks for your flight, as some airlines are becoming stricter about these charging devices. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Google Calendar finally lets you manage calendar sharing right from the app
items.summary: You don't have to use the desktop site to share calendars anymore.
items.body: TL;DR New calendar sharing options are available in the Google Calendar app. You can now share and unsubscribe from calendars using your phone. These actions were previously only possible in the desktop Calendar interface. Early this year, we shared evidence that the Google Calendar app was cooking up new sharing controls , a change that would save users having to use the desktop interface to share calendars with others, as well as to unsubscribe from calendars you no longer want to see. Those changes are now rolling out widely. As of version 2025.38.0-809757839-release of Google Calendar, the app presents options to share individual calendars with other users or groups, right from your phone. The option isnâ€™t terribly obvious, nested under Settings in Google Calendarâ€™s side panel menu. But considering these actions werenâ€™t possible in the app at all up until now, itâ€™s definitely an improvement.

items.title: Paying for Google Home Premium is an absolute non-starter for me
items.summary: I could really do without a smart home maintenance fee, thank you very much.
items.body: This week, Google launched the next big evolution of Home, bringing in Gemini to replace Assistant , giving the Home app an overhaul , and introducing a slate of new hardware. While thereâ€™s a lot I really like about some of these changes, thereâ€™s also a huge downside that now has me looking at Google Home in an increasingly negative light: Home Premium subscriptions. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Recommendations announced for influenza vaccine composition for the 2026 southern hemisphere influenza season
items.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) today announced its recommendations for the viral composition of influenza vaccines for use in the 2026 influenza season in the southern hemisphere. The announcement was made at an Information Meeting after a 4-day Consultation on the Composition of Influenza Virâ€¦

items.title: Member States advance vital work in support of WHO Pandemic Agreement
items.summary: WHO Member States are actively progressing with the development of the Pathogens Access and Benefit Sharing (PABS) system, a key component of the WHO Pandemic Agreement aimed at ensuring equitable and timely sharing of pathogen materials and related benefits. items.title: Uncontrolled high blood pressure puts over a billion people at risk
items.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) today released its second Global hypertension report, showing that 1.4 billion people lived with hypertension in 2024, yet just over one in five have it under control either through medication or addressing modifiable health risks.

items.title: Amended International Health Regulations enter into force
items.summary: Today marks a milestone in global health governance as the amendments to the International Health Regulations (IHR) enter into force. This reflects a renewed global commitment to cooperation in the face of public health emergencies, shaped by hard-earned lessons of the COVID-19 pandemic.

items.title: WHO urges cost effective solutions on NCDs and mental health amidst slowing progress
items.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) today released a new report titled â€œSaving lives, spending lessâ€, revealing that an additional investment of just US$3 per person annually in tackling noncommunicable diseases (NCDs) could yield economic benefits of up to US$1 trillion by 2030.

items.title: Cholera kills more people for second consecutive year, while prevention and treatment available
items.summary: The global cholera statistics for 2024, shows an increase in both the number of people who fell sick and died from the disease. Reported cholera cases rose by 5% and deaths by 50% in 2024 compared to 2023, with more than 6000 people dying from a disease that is both preventable and treatable.

items.title: Humble & sweet, but a lion - the story of the first female Â£1m player
items.summary: Meet the person behind women's football's first Â£1m player, Arsenal's new superstar forward Olivia Smith.

items.title: WHO updates list of essential medicines to include key cancer, diabetes treatments
items.summary: Today, the World Health Organization (WHO) has released updated editions of its Model Lists of Essential Medicines (EML) and Essential Medicines for Children (EMLc), adding new treatments for various types of cancer and for diabetes with associated comorbidities such as obesity. Medicines for cystiâ€¦

items.title: Over a billion people living with mental health conditions â€“ services require urgent scale-up
items.summary: More than 1 billion people are living with mental health disorders, according to new data released by the World Health Organization (WHO). The new findings published in two reports â€“ World mental health today and Mental Health Atlas 2024 â€“ highlight some areas of progress while exposing significantâ€¦

items.title: 'People looked at me like I was a something, not someone'
items.summary: In a candid interview, World Cup winner Heather Fisher discusses losing her hair and the struggle she had with her identity.

items.title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
items.summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.

items.title: WHO, WMO issue new report and guidance to protect workers from increasing heat stress
items.summary: The WHO and WMO have released a comprehensive technical report and guidance addressing the escalating global health and economic risks posed by extreme heat, particularly in the workplace. This guidance builds on five decades of research and responds to the record-breaking temperatures of recent yeâ€¦

items.title: 'He has made young players dream' - the making of Liverpool icon Salah
items.summary: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

items.title: WHO designates new WHO-Listed Authorities, strengthening global access to quality-assured medical products
items.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) has officially designated Health Canada, the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare/Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency (MHLW/PMDA) of Japan, and the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) of the United Kingdom as WHO-Listed Authoritiesâ€¦

items.title: Kenya achieves elimination of human African trypanosomiasis or sleeping sickness as a public health problem
items.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) has validated Kenya as having eliminated human African trypanosomiasis (HAT) or sleeping sickness as a public health problem, making it the tenth country to reach this important milestone. HAT is the second neglected tropical disease (NTD) to be eliminated in Kenâ€¦

items.title: On World Breastfeeding Week, countries urged to invest in health systems and support breastfeeding mothers
items.summary: Strengthening health systems to support breastfeeding is not just a health imperative, it is a moral and economic imperative. WHO and UNICEF remain committed to supporting countries to build resilient health systems that leave no mother or child behind.

items.title: Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in fight in US

items.title: Global hunger declines, but rises in Africa and western Asia: UN report
items.summary: An estimated 8.2 percent of the global population, or about 673 million people, experienced hunger in 2024, according to the latest State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World (SOFI) report published today by five United Nations specialized agencies.

items.title: WHO urges action on hepatitis, announcing hepatitis D as carcinogenic
items.summary: As we mark World Hepatitis Day, WHO calls on governments and partners to urgently accelerate efforts to eliminate viral hepatitis as a public health threat and reduce liver cancer deaths.
